body.section: Helion OpenStack 2.0 Installation Beginning with HP Helion OpenStack 2.0 Beta 2, you have two options for installing your cloud. You can use a GUI that runs in your web browser or you can install via a CLI that exposes the full power and flexibility of HP Helion OpenStack 2.0.

You should use the GUI if:
You are installing a simple demo or proof-of-concept cloud.
You have less than about 15 nodes (it will work for larger numbers but entering all that data in the GUI will get tiresome).
You are not planning to deploy availability zones or use L3 segmentation in your initial deployment.
You are happy with the tuned HP default OpenStack configuration. Instructions for installing via the GUI are here.
Note that reconfiguration of your cloud, at the moment, is done via the CLI. The GUI installer if for first-time installation.

You should use the CLI if:
You are installing a more complex or large-scale cloud.
You have more than about 15 nodes.
You need to use availability zones or the server groups functionality of the cloud model (link this text to model docs).
You want to customize the cloud configuration beyond the tuned defaults that HP provides out of the box.
You need deeper customizations than are possible to express using the GUI. Instructions for installing via the CLI are here
